
# inner_hash_fields.proto API Document

*Document generated by protoc-gen-markdown. DO NOT EDIT!*

> APIs


* [InnerHashFields](#innerhashfields) - Inner hash fields counter service.


	* [Increase (/counter/inner/hash_fields/{product}/{type}/{relate_id})](#increase) - Increase hash fields values.


	* [Get (/counter/inner/hash_fields/{product}/{type}/{relate_id}/{fields})](#get) - Get hash fields values.


	* [Set (/counter/inner/hash_fields/{product}/{type}/{relate_id})](#set) - Set hash fields values.


	* [Gets (/counter/inner/hash/{product}/{type}/{relate_ids})](#gets) - Get hash keys.





<h2 id="innerhashfields">InnerHashFields</h2>

>  Inner hash fields counter service.



<h3 id="increase">Increase</h3>

>  Increase hash fields values.



* HTTP Gateway

	* URL: `/counter/inner/hash_fields/{product}/{type}/{relate_id}`
	* Method: `PUT`
	* Content-Type: `application/json`

* Request Type: ***HashFieldsKey***

>  Hash fields key.

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|product|string|string| Counter product|-|true|
|type|string|string| Counter type|-|true|
|relate_id|string|string| Counter relate ID|-|true|
|fields|array [string]|string| Counter relate ID fields|-|false|
|values|map\<string, int64\>|object| Counter relate ID field values|-|false|




> JSON Demo

```json
{
  "product": "string",
  "type": "string",
  "relate_id": "string",
  "fields": [
    "string"
  ],
  "values": {
    "string": "string($int64)"
  }
}
```



* Response Type: ***HashFieldsKey***

>  Hash fields key.

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|product|string|string| Counter product|-|true|
|type|string|string| Counter type|-|true|
|relate_id|string|string| Counter relate ID|-|true|
|fields|array [string]|string| Counter relate ID fields|-|false|
|values|map\<string, int64\>|object| Counter relate ID field values|-|false|



> JSON Demo

```json
{

  "type": "string",
  "relate_id": "string",
  "fields": [
    "string"
  ],
  "values": {
    "string": "string($int64)"
  }
}
```

* Request Type: ***HashFieldsKey***

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|

|product|string|string| Counter product|-|true|
|type|string|string| Counter type|-|true|

* Response Type: ***Empty***

>  A generic empty message that you can re-use to avoid defining duplicated
>  empty messages in your APIs. A typical example is to use it as the request
>  or the response type of an API method. For instance:
> 
>      service Foo {
>        rpc Bar(google.protobuf.Empty) returns (google.protobuf.Empty);
>      }
> 
>  The JSON representation for `Empty` is empty JSON object `{}`.

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|


<h3 id="gets">Gets</h3>

>  Get hash keys.



* HTTP Gateway

	* URL: `/counter/inner/hash/{product}/{type}/{relate_ids}`
	* Method: `GET`


* Request Type: ***HashKeys***

>  Hash keys.

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|product|string|string| Counter product|-|true|
|type|string|string| Counter type|-|true|
|relate_ids|array [string]|string| Counter relate IDs|-|false|






* Response Type: ***HashValues***

>  Hash counter key values.

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|values|map\<string, [HashValue](#hashvalue)\>|object| Hash counter values.|-|false|



> JSON Demo

```json
{
  "values": {
    "string": {
      "field_values": {
        "string": "string($int64)"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

<h3 id="hashvalue">HashValue</h3>

>  Hash all fields values.

* Fields

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
